Package gov.sandia.gmp.util.numerical.matrix

Class LUDecomposition

java.lang.Object
gov.sandia.gmp.util.numerical.matrix.LUDecomposition
All Implemented Interfaces:
MatrixSolver, Serializable
public class LUDecomposition extends Object implements MatrixSolver, Serializable
LU Decomposition.

For an m-by-n matrix A with m >= n, the LU decomposition is an m-by-n unit lower triangular matrix L, an n-by-n upper triangular matrix U, and a permutation vector piv of length m so that A(piv,:) = L*U. If m < n, then L is m-by-m and U is m-by-n.

The LU decomposition with pivoting always exists, even if the matrix is singular, so the constructor will never fail. The primary use of the LU decomposition is in the solution of square systems of simultaneous linear equations. This will fail if isNonsingular() returns false.

See Also:
Serialized Form

    • solve

      public void solve​(double[][] a, double[][] b)
      Solve A*a = b
      Specified by:
      solve in interface MatrixSolver
      Parameters:
      a - The solution matrix with as many or more rows than A and at least 1 column that will contain the solution on exit. Note that a will be resized to the size of b on exit but only the first n rows contain the solution.
      b - The RHS Matrix with as many or more rows than A and at least 1 column.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - Matrix row dimensions must equal or exceed m.

    • solve

      public void solve​(double[] a, double[] b)
      Solve A*a = b
      Parameters:
      a - The solution matrix with as many or more rows than A which will contain the solution on exit. Note that a will be resized to the size of b on exit (if it has fewer rows) but only the first n rows contain the solution.
      b - The RHS Matrix with as many or more rows than A.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - Matrix row dimensions must equal or exceed m.

      public double[][] inverse()
      Solve LU * [LU]^-1 = I for [LU]^-1
      Returns:
      The inverse matrix of this decomposition.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - Matrix row dimensions must equal or exceed m.
      RuntimeException - Matrix is singular.

    • solve

      public void solve​(double[][] a)
      Solve A*a = b
      Specified by:
      solve in interface MatrixSolver
      Parameters:
      a - The solution matrix containing b on entry with as many or more rows than A and at least 1 column that will contain the RHS on entry and the solution on exit. Note the solution only overwrites the first n rows of a if m > n.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - Matrix row dimensions must equal or exceed m.
      RuntimeException - Matrix is singular.
